COBB.raw_line: What's the most resilient parasite?A bacteria? A virus?An intestinal worm?An idea.Resilient, highly contagious. Once an idea's taken hold in the brain it's almost impossible to eradicate. A person can cover it up, ignore it- but it stays there.Information, yes. But an idea? Fully formed, understood? That sticks... In there, somewhere.But, Mr. Saito, we can train your subconscious to defend itself from even the most skilled extractor.Because I am the most skilled extractor. I know how to search your mind and find your secrets. I know the tricks, and I can teach them to your subconscious so that even when you're asleep, your guard is never down.But if I'm going to help you, you have to be completely open to me. I'll need to know my way around your thoughts better than your wife, your analyst, anyone. If this is a dream and you've got a safe full of secrets, I need to know what's in that safe. For this to work, you have to let me in.I can get it here. The information's in the safe- he looked right at it when I mentioned secrets.You just get to your room. I'll take care of the rest.With a clean dive, perhaps. Mal, why are you here?I am. But I can't trust you anymore.Actually, Mr. Saito is partial to postwar British painters.Would you sit down?You can't imagine.Getting some air.Stay seated. Please.Did she tell you, or have you known all along?No point threatening him in a dream.You came prepared.Hard for a man in your position to keep a love nest totally secret... particularly when there's a married woman involved.And yet, here we are.With a dilemma.Not quite. The key piece of information wasn't there, was it, Mr. Saito?You held something back because you knew what we were up to...So why let us in at all?Audition for what?I extracted all the information you had in there.You know the corporation who hired us won't accept failure. We won't last two days...So now I have to do this the old- fashioned way-We're not in your dream-Lets go.I had it under control.There's no time for this-I'm getting off at Kyoto.I can't stand trains.Every man for himself.Hey, guys. How are you?Who's just okay? Was that James?I can't. Not for a while.Well, James, like I've told you-I'm away because I'm working...Philippa, can you ask Grandma to pick up the phone-Well, we'll just have to hope Grandma's wrong about that won't we?Yes?No. No, we talked about this, James. Mommy's gone.I'll give some presents to Grandpa, okay? Just be good for-Yeah, why?Yeah. I'm sorry about your leg.One apology's all you're getting, Arthur. Now, where's Nash?We were supposed to deliver Saito's expansion plans to Cobol Engineering two hours ago. By now they know we failed. Time to disappear.Buenos Aires. I can lie low there. Maybe sniff out a job when things quiet down. You?) 'Course. Send my regards.That's not how I deal with things.What will you do to him?What do you want from us?No, it isn't.I won't do it.Are you giving me a choice? Because I can find my own way to square things with Cobol.And I choose to leave.You can't fix that. Nobody could.How complex is the idea?No idea's simple when you have to plant it in someone else's mind.If I were to do it. If I could do it... how do I know you can deliver?No, you don't.It can. You just have to go deep enough.I've done it before.Yes.We're going to need a new architect.You never did like your office.Extradition between France and the U.S. is a bureaucratic nightmare.Can you take these back for the kids?I know. I thought you could talk to Marie about bringing them on vacation. Somewhere I could meet-You were married for twenty years.Doesn't she understand that my kids need me?Be realistic, Stephen. They'd never understand- they'd lock me up and throwaway the key. Or worse.Lawyers don't pay for themselves. This is what I have. This is what you taught me.No, you taught me to navigate other people's minds. But after what happened with Mal there weren't a whole lot of legitimate ways for me to use that skill.I found a way home. A job. For powerful people. If I pull it off, I can get back to my family. But I need help.If you have someone good enough, you have to let them decide for themselves. You know what I'm offering-No, not just money: the chance to build cathedrals, entire cities- things that have never existed, things that couldn't exist in the real world...That's not what you used to say. You told me that in the real world I'd be building attic conversions and gas stations. You said that if I mastered the dream-share I'd have a whole new way of creating and showing people my creations. You told me it would free me.No, you weren't. Your vision was a vision of pure creativity. It's where we took it that was wrong.They won't actually come on the job, they'll just design the levels and teach them to the dreamers.Mal won't let me.You want to know what's real, Stephen? Your grandchildren waiting for their dad to come back.This job-this last job-is how I get there.I wouldn't be standing here if there were any other way. I can get home. But I need an architect who's as good as I was.(smiles Not exactly.A test.Before I describe the job, I have to know you could do it.It's not, strictly speaking, legal.You have two minutes to draw a maze that takes me one minute to solve.Go.Stop.Again.Stop.You'll have to-More like it.They say we only use a fraction of the true potential of our brains... but they're talking about when we're awake. While we dream, the mind performs wonders.How do you imagine a building? You consciously create each aspect, puzzling over it in stages... But sometimes, when your imagination flies-Exactly. Genuine inspiration.In a dream your mind continuously does that...It creates and perceives a world simultaneously. So well that you don't feel your brain doing the creating. That's why we can short- circuit the process...By taking over the creating part.This is where you come in. You build the world of the dream. We take the subject into that dream, and let him £111 it with his subconsciousWhile we're in there, We don't want him to realize he's dreaming.Our dreams reel real while we're in them. It's only when we wake up we realize things were strange,It does. Every time you dream. Let me ask you a question: You never remember the beginning of your dreams, do you? You just turn up in the middle of what's going on.So... how did we end up at this restaurant?How did we get here? Where are we?Stay calm. We're actually asleep in the workshop. This is your first lesson in shared dreaming, remember?Because it's never just a dream.And a face full of glass hurts like hell, doesn't it? While we're in it, it's real.Someone had to design the dreams. Let's go another five minutes-When you dream, your mind functions more quickly, so time seems to pass more slowly.Let's see how much trouble you can cause in five minutes.It's good. You've got the cafe, the layout... you forgot the book shop but pretty much everything else is here.They're projections of my subconscious.Sure-you are the dreamer, I am the subject. My subconscious populates your world. That's one way we get at a subject's thoughts-his mind creates the people, so we can literally talk to his subconscious.Architecture. Build a bank vault or a jail, something secure, and the subject's mind will fill it with information he's trying to protect.Exactly.Yes. It is.Because you're changing things. My subconscious feels that someone else is creating the world. The more you change things, the quicker the projections converge on you.They feel the foreign nature of the dreamer, and attack-like white blood cells fighting an infection.Just you, actually.It's beautiful... but if you keep on changing things...That's why it's called subconscious. I don't control it.Arched stone, iron pillars... it's...I know this bridge. This place is real- You didn't imagine it, you remembered it...Never recreate places from your memory. Always imagine new places.Use pieces-a streetlamp, phonebooths, a type of brick-not whole areas.Because building dreams out of your own memories is the surest way to lose your grip on what's real and what's a dream.Look, this isn't about me-Leave her alone-Mal, no!She'll need a totem.She'll be back.I've never seen anyone pick it up so fast. And one reality won't be enough for her now. When she comes back, get her building mazes.I've got to talk to Eames.Necessary risk.We don't just need a thief. We need a forger.Rub them against each other all you like, they're not going to breed.Drink?You're spelling hasn't improved.How's your handwriting?Yeah?You wouldn't sell me out.Not when you hear what I'm selling.Inception.Don't bother telling me it's impossible.That's what I keep saying to Arthur.He's a good point man.You've done it before?You didn't plant it deep enough?That's why I'm here.We want the heir to a major corporation to break up his father's empire.Which is?Let's go see him.Cobol Engineering?Run interference. We'll meet downstairs in half an hour.Last place they'd expect.Yes?What brings you to Mombasa, Mr. Saito?Different tail.What's your problem with Fischer?This isn't the usual corporate espionage, Mr. Saito. This is inception. The seed of the idea we plant will grow in this man's mind. It'll change him. It might even come to define him.Then you need new sources, Mr. Saito.We'll need more than rumor, Mr. Saito.You're well informed, Mr. Yusuf.Somnacin?As good as the real thing?And to come into the held with us.We need you there to tailor compounds to our particular requirements.Great depth.Three.I've done it before. You just have to add a sedative.Five.There's no room for tourists on these jobs, Mr. Saito.For what?How long do they dream?How long in dream time?After a while... It becomes the only way you can dream.Let's see what you can do.Everything's fine.I just-I need to test some things. I didn't realize anyone was here.Let me see-You're learning.No. Mal's.This one was hers. She'd spin it in a dream and it would never topple. Just spin and spin...She did. How are the mazes coming?Don't tell me. Remember, you only want the dreamer to know the layout.In case one of us brings in part of our subconscious. You wouldn't want any projections knowing the layout.No.I didn't say it's getting worse. Look, Ariadne, I need them for this job. I need you for this job. Without your help, I'll never get back to my children. And that's all I can care about right now.They think I killed her.Thank you.Not asking whether I did.The mark is Robert Fischer, heir to the Australian energy conglomerate, Fischer Morrow.An idea Robert Fischer's conscious mind would never accept. We have to plant it deep in his subconscious.Three levels down.Yes. It is.Now, the subconscious motivates through emotion, not reason, so we have to translate the idea into an emotional concept.That's what we have to figure out. Robert and his father have a tense relationship. Worse, even, than the gossip columns have suggested...No. Positive emotion trumps negative emotion every time. We yearn for people to be reconciled, for catharsis. We need positive emotional logic.That might work.Inception's not about specificity. When we get inside his head, we're going to have to work with what we find.How do you mean?"MY FATHER DOESN'T WANT ME TO BE HIM."Suppress them. We don't bring our own projections into the dream-we let Fischer's subconscious supply the people.I thought he had some knee thing?Surely he flies private?Why?Neater, huh? Well, now we have ten uninterrupted hours.Nice lobby, by the way.Buying us more time in each level.It's basically a week one layer down, six months two layers down-A kick.That feeling of falling which snaps you awake. We use that to jolt ourselves awake once we're done.The trick is to devise a kick for each level, then synchronize them to get a snap that penetrates all three layers.Of course...That we'd grow old together.You shouldn't be in here.This is the only way I can still dream.In my dreams... we're still together.And I shouldn't.No.No. These are moments I regret. Moments I turned into dreams so I could change them.There's only one thing I need you to understand about me...Mine and Mal's.She'd already died.It's James. My boy. He's found something. Maybe a worm.And there's Philippa.I thought about calling out, so they'd turn and smile those incredible smiles... but I'm out of time-Then I panic that I'll always wish I'd seen them turn, that I can't waste this chance...But the moment's passed. And whatever I do, the dream's always the same... When I'm about to call... they run.If I'm going to see their faces again-I've got to get back here in the real world...Because you'll be together.A hotel. We spent our anniversaries in this suite.We can. We will. But I need you to stay here for now-I'll come back. I need you to stay here on your own for now. Just while I do this job. Then we can be together-When's the funeral?Robert'll accompany the body Tuesday at the outside. We have to move.No. I promised Miles.We need one more seat on the plane.If I get on this plane and you haven't taken care of things... when we land I go to jail for the rest of my life.Excuse me?I think this is yours...Same.No problem. Look, I couldn't help noticing your name. You're not related to Maurice Fischer?I'm very sorry for your loss. He was an inspiring figure.Thanks.To Maurice Fischer. I'll leave you in peace.At least we know he'll be looking for a cab in this.Brace yourselves.Walk away.Come on!-Arthur! Arthur what the-Oh, Christ. Is he dying?We were blocked by a freight train.Why were we all ambushed, Arthur?! Those weren't regular projections- they'd been trained!So why the hell didn't it?!Don't tell me to calm down-you were meant to check Fischer's background thoroughly. You can't make this kind of mistake-we're not prepared for this kind of violence-This wasn't part of the plan, Arthur! He's dying!No.No! It won't wake him up.That person doesn't wake up. Their mind drops into Limbo.There wasn't meant to be any risk. We weren't supposed to be dealing with a load of gunnre.It's the only way you can go three layers deep, Arthur.You don't know anything about that. This was the only way to do this job, Arthur. I did what I had to do to get back to my children.We have a way out. The kick. We just have to push on, do the job as fast as possible and get out using the kick.You'll never make it, Eames. Fischer's security is surrounding this place as we speak. The ten hours of the flight is a week at this level-you'll never make it without getting killed. Downwards is the only way forwards. We have to carry on.And we have to do it fast.Eames, go get ready. Arthur, let's get in there and soften him up.No, it won't.Doesn't mean you don't know the combination.You're on. You've got an hour.And Saito was supposed to keep his guts on the inside. You've got an hour-get something we can use.You've got an hour. Get talking.How's he doing?When we get you down to the next level, the pain will be less intense.His conscious mind will drop out of the dream. He'll be trapped in Limbo for a lifetime...When he wakes... his mind could be completely gone.Saito-san, when you wake you might not even remember that we had an arrangement. You'll have forgotten this world. Limbo will be your reality. Lost there so long, you'll have become an old man...Waiting to die alone. Yes.What truth?We were on a job. Exploring dreams within dreams. But we didn't understand how your mind can turn hours into years. How you can get trapped. Trapped so deep that when you wash up on the shore of your subconscious...You can lose track of what's real.Fifty years.We built. We created a whole world for ourselves...It's not so bad at first, being gods. The problem is knowing that it's not real. It became impossible for me to live like that.She accepted it. At some point......she'd decided to forget that our world wasn't real.To wake from that. From decades lived. To be old souls thrown back into youth. It was hard. At first Mal seemed okay. But I started to realize something was wrong. Finally she admitted it. This idea she was possessed by. This simple little idea that changed everything...That our world was not real. No matter what I did, no matter what I said, she was convinced that we were still in a dream. That we needed to wake up again...That to get home we'd have to kill ourselves.She... she believed they weren't real. That our real children were waiting. Somewhere above...Calm down, Mal-If it's my dream then why can't I control it? Why can't I stop this?You keep telling me I am-She was certain. But she loved me too much to go without me. So she made a plan...For our anniversary...Mal, come back inside.No, I'm not. This is real-if you jump, you're not going to wake up, you're going to die. Let's go back inside and talk about this, please.I can't do that, Mal. I can't leave our children.What do you mean?Out children are here, Mal.NO! MAL, NO, I CAN'T!DON'T DO THIS!DON'T!NO!He letter to the authorities refuted all the claims about her sanity that she knew I'd make...She'd had herself declared sane by three different psychiatrists.It was impossible for me to explain the nature of her madness...So I ran. And I've been running ever since, trying to buy my way back to my family...She was sane. She was just lost in the labyrinth.Because we were a family. And we had a life I would do anything to get back to now. But that reality wasn't enough for me then.You don't have to do this for me-We can't stay here. Arthur?!Come to your senses?Let's try instinctively. I have someone standing in your father's office ready to tap in a combination.First six numbers that come into your head. Right now.RIGHT NOW!You'll have to do better. Bag `em.The stronger the issues, the more powerful the catharsis.Shifting Fischer's antipathy from his father onto Browning should work.No. We repair his relationship with his father and expose his godfather's true nature.We bring in Mr. Charles.Arthur, the second we approach Fischer in that hotel, they're gonna mow us down-we run with Mr. Charles like on the Stein job.I'll need a decoy.Fine-I know you've got to stay ahead of them, but drive with kid gloves, okay? The world down there is going to be very unstable-Mr. Fishcer! Good to see you again. Rod Green, Marketing. And you must be...I think you just got blown off... unless her phone number really does have only six digits.Strange way to make friends. Lifting your wallet, I mean.Five hundred bucks. I know. Don't worry, my guys are on it.I said I was Rod Green from Marketing-but I'm not. My name is Mr. Charles. I might seem familiar to you. I'm in charge of your security here.No. My specialty is subconscious security.Exactly. My job is to protect you...My job is to protect you from any attempt to access your mind through your dreams.You're not safe here.Trust me. They're coming for you.Strange weather, huh?You feel that?Very odd-the weather, the gravity...But I can explain all this. You've actually been trained for this. Think of the strangeness of the weather, the shifts in gravity. None of this is real...We're in a dream.The simplest test of what I'm saying is for you to try and remember anything about the way you arrived in this hotel... okay?Breathe. Remember the training. Accept the fact that we're in a dream. That's why I'm here protecting you.No. I'm a projection of your subconscious. I was put in place to protect you in the event that extractors pulled you into a dream. I believe that's what has happened.Look at the gun in his hand.These men were sent to abduct you.If I'm going to help you, I need you to be calm.I wouldn't do that-they've probably got you sedated. If you pull that trigger, you might not wake up, you might drop into a lower dream state.Mr. Fischer, you know all this, you just have to remember it...What do you remember from before this dream?Where were they holding you?Your body's bouncing around in the back of a van right now-that explains the gravity shifts.It's like trying to remember a dream after you've woken up. It takes years of practice to do it easily. So, you and Browning have been pulled into this dream so they can steal something from your mind. What?That's them extracting a locator.A number from your own subconscious. It can be used any number of ways... This is a hotel. Room numbers. What was the number you gave them?Well, we know where to start. Fifth floor.They work for me.You know what this is?They were going to put you under.Under again.You said you were kidnapped together?You saw them torture him?Your godfather's lying, Robert.It's what I do. He's hiding something.Let's find out what.Let's do to him what he was going to do to you.We'll penetrate his subconscious and find out what he doesn't want you to know.Fischer's. I told him it was Browning's so he'd come with us as part of our team.That's the idea. He'll think that his security is Browning's and fight them to learn the truth about his father.Fischer's subconscious is going to run you down hard.Be back in time for the kick.Hopefully, the truth we want Fischer to learn.You're the dreamer. I need you to draw the security away from the complex.If I know the route... we could be compromised.No. You're with me.Eames, brief Saito on the route into the complex. What we're looking for is going to be in the most heavily fortified section. That north tower.Mr. Fischer, you're going in with Mr. Saito.You have to do this on your own. You have to get in there, break into your godfather's mind and find out the truth about your father.Keep this live at all times. I'll be listening in, covering you. The windows on the upper floors are big enough that I can cover you from that south tower.No, it's music. Dammit.We move fast. Saito, did you copy?Yusuf's about ten seconds from the jump, which gives Arthur about three minutes, which gives us about-The route you gave them, can they do it in under an hour?They need a new route-a direct route.There must be access routes that cut through the maze. Eames?Did Eames add any features?What did he add?There's no time-what did he add?What about service features? Did he add any large pipes or-Explain it to them.The kick.Yeah, we missed it.Finish the job before the next kick.When the van hits the water. I figure Arthur's got a couple minutes and we've got about twenty.What about the strongroom? Doesn't it have any windows?It's fine. Better hope that we like what Fischer finds in there.Yeah.No, of course not. They're just projections.Buy us some time.You're clear, but hurry-there's an army headed your way...Shit. There's someone else in there.Come on... a little lower... a little-How can you know that?I wouldn't shoot her.It won't do any good-Even if you could revive his body, his mind's trapped down there. It's over.I'm sorry.Saito's not going to last, Eames.And I can find her. She'll have Fischer.She wants me to come after him. She wants me back down there with her.It was. And this is where she'll be.We both did.We built for years. Then, when that got stale, we started in on the memories.This is our neighborhood.No. Our neighborhood. That was our first apartment... then we moved to that building... we got that small house when Mal became pregnant.We had time.The house Mal grew up in.No. Come on-We both wanted a house, but we both loved skyscrapers. In the real world we had to choose. Not here.We need some kind of kick.I'll improvise.There's something you have to understand about me. About inception. You see, an idea is like a virus...Resilient... Highly contagious, and an idea can grow. The smallest seed of an idea can grow to define or destroy your world...I know what's real.I know what's real.I have chosen, Mal. Our children. I have to get back to them. Because you left them. You left us.Our real children are waiting for me up above.They're not real, Mal. Our real children are waiting for us-I know it-Guilt. I feel guilt. And however confused I might get.However lost I might seem... it's always there. Telling me something. Reminding me of the truth.That you were wrong to doubt our world. That the idea that drove you to question your reality was a lie...Because it was my lie.Because I performed inception on my own wife, then reaped the bitter rewards...We'd become lost in here. Living in a world of infinite possibilities. A world where we were gods. I realized we needed to escape, but she'd locked away her knowledge of the unreality of this world...I couldn't make Mal understand that we needed to break free. To die. So I started to search our world...Searching for the right place in her mind...And when I found that place, that secret place where she had shut away her knowledge years before, I broke it open...I broke into the deepest recess of her mind, to give her the simplest little idea.A truth that she had once known, but had chosen to forget...That her world was not real.That death was a necessary escape.You're waiting for a train. A train that will take you far away. You know where you hope this train will take you, but you can't know for sure. Yet it doesn't matter...I never thought that the idea I'd planted would grow in her mind like a cancer. That even after we woke...You'd continue to believe that your world was not real...I was trying to save you-I'm sorry.If I stay, can she take him back?Go check he's alive, Ariadne.Send Fischer, I have to stay-I'm not. Saito is dead by now. That means he's here. I have to stay here and find him.I can't stay here to be with her because she's not real.I wish you were. But I couldn't make you real. I'm not capable of imagining you in all your complexity and... perfection. As you really were. You're the best I can do. And you're not real.What're you doing?No!That's the kick-you have to go!No, I'm not. I'm staying here to find Saito. And to say goodbye.I will.I know. But we can't. And I'm sorry.And we did...I miss you more than I can bear... but we had our time together. And now I have to let go...Someone from your half-remembered dream...?Filled with regret?I came back for you... I came to remind you of what you once knew...That this world is not real.Yes. And to take a leap of faith.Come back and we'll be young men together again.

ARIADNE.raw_line: Pleased to meet you.A work placement?Aren't you going to tell me anything?Why?Such as?I'm discovering it.How?But are you trying to fool him that the dream is actually real life?How could I ever get enough detail to Convince him that it's real?But all the textures of real life- the stone, the fabric. cars... people... your mind can't create all this.I guess.We came here from...Oh my God. We're dreaming.If it's just a dream, why are you covering your-How did architects get involved?We were only asleep for five minutes? We talked for an hour at least...Who are the people?Yours?How else do you do it?Then you break in and steal it.I love the concrete sense of things- Real weight, you know? I thought a dream space would be all about the visual, but it's the feel of things. Question is, what happens as you start to mess with physics...It's something, isn't it?Why are they looking at me?Converge?They're going to attack us?Mind telling your subconscious to take it easy?I cross it every day on my way to the college.You have to draw from what you know-Why not?Did that happen to you?Is that why you need me to build your dreams?Wake me up, Cobb.Wake me up!Why couldn't I wake?What?That's some subconscious you've got, Cobb. She's a real charmer!She's his wife?Like a coin?What's yours?Why?That's not an issue for me.Arthur, maybe you can't see what's going on, maybe you don't want to. But Cobb's got problems he's tried to bury down there. I'm not going to open my mind to someone like that.I tried not to come.No paper, no pens... nothing between you and raw, direct creation.What sort of tricks?How big do the levels have to be?A maze.The longer we have before the projections catch us.My subconscious seems polite enough.Cobb can't build anymore, can he?Why?His ex-wife?They're still together?What was she like in real life?You're back.Are you going under on your own?Just working on my totem.It's an elegant solution to keeping track of reality. Your invention?Arthur told me she died.Good. Each level relates to the part of the subject's subconscious we're trying to access. I'm making the bottom level a hospital, so that Fischer will bring his father there-Why's that so important?In case you bring Mal in.You won't build yourself because if you know the maze, then she knows it. And she'd sabotage the operation. You can't keep her out, can you?Do the others know?You have to warn them if it's getting worse-Why can't you go home, Cobb?How did she die?For what?How much time?And ten years in the third level. Who wants to spend ten years in a dream?What's a kick?I wanted to know what "tests" you need to do on your own every night.Why do you do this to yourself?Is it so important to dream?But these aren't just dreams, are they? They're memories. You said never to use memories.You're keeping her alive.You can't let her go.What've you got buried down there that you regret?This is your house?Where is she?My name is-I don't know. Trying to understand.No.What is this place?What happened here?You think you can just build a prison of memories to lock her in? You think that's going to contain her?I'm coming with you.The team needs someone in there who understands what you're struggling with. If you don't want it to be me then you need to show Arthur what I just saw.This wasn't in the design-I didn't.How could they be trained?Limbo?What's down there?How long would we be stuck there?He's in a lot of pain.And if he dies?What will that do to him?When were you trapped in Limbo?Cobb, you might have convinced the rest of this team to carry on with the job. But they don't know the truth.The truth that at any minute you might bring a freight train through the wall. The truth that Mal is bursting up through your subconscious.The truth that as we go deeper into Fischer, we're also going deeper into you-and I'm not sure we're going to like what we find there.This is not just about Fischer, it's about you. Tell me what happened to you and Mal. Trapped in Limbo.How long were you stuck?How did you stand it?But not for her?And when you finally woke up?What was it?What about your children?Psychiatrists judged her sane?Then why should you blame yourself?It might have been your idea to push the limits, Cobb. But you're not responsible for the idea that destroyed her. The idea that her world wasn't real... that was her own idea from her own mind.Your guilt defines her. Powers her. If we're going to succeed in this, you're going to have to forgive yourself, and you're going to have to confront her. But you don't have to do it alone.I'm doing it for the others. They don't know the risk they've taken coming in here with you.So you destroy his one positive relationship?Who or what, exactly, is Mr. Charles?And why don't you approve?Didn't Cobb say never to do that?What's happening?Do you use a timer?How will you know?Why not?Wait, Cobb-I'm lost. Whose subconscious are we going into?Cobb? Cobb?What's down there?I meant what's down there for you?I designed the place.How long do we have?Sixty minutes.I don't think so. They've still got to climb down to the middle terrace.The building's designed as a labyrinth.Yes.I shouldn't tell you. If Mal-Utility closets, trap doors...Ducts. He added an air duct system- it doesn't follow the maze. They can use it to go straight from the outer walls to the upper tower.Saito?What was that?That's the antechamber outside the strongroom.Wouldn't be very strong if it did. Look, if you wanted to design it yourself-These projections, they're part of his subconscious?Are you destroying those parts of his mind?Fischer, stop! It's a trap!-Cobb, that's not really her-Fischer, look out!-Cobb, she's just a projection. Fischer... he's real.Eames? Get to the anteroom now!Mal killed Fischer-There's still a way: We follow Fischer down-Down there they'll be enough time. We'll find him-soon as you hear Arthur's music start, you use the defibrillator to revive him-we give him his own early kick from below.Get him in there- Then, as the music ends you blow the hospital and we all ride the kick back up through the layers.We have to try!Can I trust you to do what's needed? Mal's down there-How do you know?This is your world?You built all this?It's incredible.From what city?You reconstructed them all from memory?What's that?Will she be in there?How do we send Fischer back?What?Why?We need Fischer.Cobb, what are you saying?Cobb, you can't do this.He's here. And it's time. But you have to come with us.Cobb, I'm not going to let you lose yourself in here! You have to get back to your children!You can't stay here to be with her-No!Improvising.You're coming!Don't lose yourself. Find Saito. And bring him back.Cobb stayed.No. To find Saito.No. He'll be alright.
